intro: Millettia fooningensis, commonly known as the Fooning millettia, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in forested areas and is adapted to humid, subtropical climates. It produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
